trans-unit.source: Use C# with Hive and Pig on Hadoop in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use C# with Hive and Pig on Hadoop in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use C# user-defined functions (UDF) with Hive and Pig streaming in Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use C# user-defined functions (UDF) with Hive and Pig streaming in Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Hive and Pig are great for working with data in Azure HDInsight, but sometimes you need a more general-purpose language.
trans-unit.target: Hive and Pig are great for working with data in Azure HDInsight, but sometimes you need a more general-purpose language.

trans-unit.source: Both Hive and Pig allow you to call external code through user-defined functions (UDFs) or streaming.
trans-unit.target: Both Hive and Pig allow you to call external code through user-defined functions (UDFs) or streaming.

trans-unit.source: In this document, learn how to use C# with Hive and Pig.
trans-unit.target: In this document, learn how to use C# with Hive and Pig.

trans-unit.source: Windows 7, Windows 8, or Windows 8.1.
trans-unit.target: Windows 7, Windows 8, or Windows 8.1.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio with the following versions:
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio with the following versions:

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2012 Professional/Premium/Ultimate with <linkText>Update 4</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2012 Professional/Premium/Ultimate with <linkText>Update 4</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2013 Community/Professional/Premium/Ultimate with <linkText>Update 4</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013 Community/Professional/Premium/Ultimate with <linkText>Update 4</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2015 Preview
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2015 Preview

trans-unit.source: Hadoop on HDInsight cluster - see <linkText>Provision an HDInsight cluster</linkText><title></title> for steps to create a cluster
trans-unit.target: Hadoop on HDInsight cluster - see <linkText>Provision an HDInsight cluster</linkText><title></title> for steps to create a cluster

trans-unit.source: Hadoop Tools for Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Hadoop Tools for Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Get started using HDInsight Hadoop Tools for Visual Studio</linkText><title></title> for steps on installing and configuring the tools.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Get started using HDInsight Hadoop Tools for Visual Studio</linkText><title></title> for steps on installing and configuring the tools.

trans-unit.source: The .NET common language runtime (CLR) and frameworks are installed by default on Windows-based HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: The .NET common language runtime (CLR) and frameworks are installed by default on Windows-based HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to use C# applications with Hive and Pig streaming (data is passed between Hive/Pig and the C# application via stdout/stdin).
trans-unit.target: This allows you to use C# applications with Hive and Pig streaming (data is passed between Hive/Pig and the C# application via stdout/stdin).

trans-unit.source: Currently there is no support for running .NET Framework applications on Linux-based HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: Currently there is no support for running .NET Framework applications on Linux-based HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: Streaming involves Hive and Pig passing data to an external application over stdout, and receiving the results over stdin.
trans-unit.target: Streaming involves Hive and Pig passing data to an external application over stdout, and receiving the results over stdin.

trans-unit.source: For C# applications, this is most easily accomplished via Console.ReadLine() and Console.WriteLine().
trans-unit.target: For C# applications, this is most easily accomplished via Console.ReadLine() and Console.WriteLine().

trans-unit.source: Since Hive and Pig need to invoke the application at run time, the Console Application template should be used for your C# projects.
trans-unit.target: Since Hive and Pig need to invoke the application at run time, the Console Application template should be used for your C# projects.

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio and create a new solution.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio and create a new solution.

trans-unit.source: For the project type, select Console Application, and name the new project HiveCSharp.
trans-unit.target: For the project type, select Console Application, and name the new project HiveCSharp.

trans-unit.source: Replace the contents of Program.cs with the following:
trans-unit.target: Replace the contents of Program.cs with the following:

trans-unit.source: Build the project.
trans-unit.target: Build the project.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open Server Explorer.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open Server Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Expand Azure, and then expand HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Expand Azure, and then expand HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: If prompted, enter your Azure subscription credentials, and then click Sign In.
trans-unit.target: If prompted, enter your Azure subscription credentials, and then click Sign In.

trans-unit.source: Expand the HDInsight cluster that you wish to deploy this application to, and then expand Default Storage Account.
trans-unit.target: Expand the HDInsight cluster that you wish to deploy this application to, and then expand Default Storage Account.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Server Explorer showing the storage account for the cluster</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Server Explorer showing the storage account for the cluster</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Double-click Default Container for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Double-click Default Container for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: This will open a new window that displays the contents of the default container.
trans-unit.target: This will open a new window that displays the contents of the default container.

trans-unit.source: Click the upload icon, and then browse to the bin\debug folder for the HiveCSharp project.
trans-unit.target: Click the upload icon, and then browse to the bin\debug folder for the HiveCSharp project.

trans-unit.source: Finally, select the HiveCSharp.exe file and click Ok.
trans-unit.target: Finally, select the HiveCSharp.exe file and click Ok.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>upload icon</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>upload icon</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once the upload has finished, you will be able to use the application from a Hive query.
trans-unit.target: Once the upload has finished, you will be able to use the application from a Hive query.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open Server Explorer.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open Server Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Expand Azure, and then expand HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Expand Azure, and then expand HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the cluster that you deployed the HiveCSharp application to, and then select Write a Hive Query.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the cluster that you deployed the HiveCSharp application to, and then select Write a Hive Query.

trans-unit.source: Use the following for the Hive query:
trans-unit.target: Use the following for the Hive query:

trans-unit.source: This selects the clientid, devicemake, and devicemodel fields from hivesampletable, and passes the fields to the HiveCSharp.exe application.
trans-unit.target: This selects the clientid, devicemake, and devicemodel fields from hivesampletable, and passes the fields to the HiveCSharp.exe application.

trans-unit.source: The query expects the application to return three fields, which are stored as clientid, phoneLabel, and phoneHash.
trans-unit.target: The query expects the application to return three fields, which are stored as clientid, phoneLabel, and phoneHash.

trans-unit.source: The query also expects to find HiveCSharp.exe in the root of the default storage container (add file wasb:///HiveCSharp.exe).
trans-unit.target: The query also expects to find HiveCSharp.exe in the root of the default storage container (add file wasb:///HiveCSharp.exe).

trans-unit.source: Click Submit to submit the job to the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Click Submit to submit the job to the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The Hive Job Summary window will open.
trans-unit.target: The Hive Job Summary window will open.

trans-unit.source: Click Refresh to refresh the summary until Job Status changes to Completed.
trans-unit.target: Click Refresh to refresh the summary until Job Status changes to Completed.

trans-unit.source: To view the job output, click Job Output.
trans-unit.target: To view the job output, click Job Output.

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio and create a new solution.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio and create a new solution.

trans-unit.source: For the project type, select Console Application, and name the new project PigUDF.
trans-unit.target: For the project type, select Console Application, and name the new project PigUDF.

trans-unit.source: Replace the contents of the Program.cs file with the following:
trans-unit.target: Replace the contents of the Program.cs file with the following:

trans-unit.source: This application will parse the lines sent from Pig, and reformat lines that begin with java.lang.Exception.
trans-unit.target: This application will parse the lines sent from Pig, and reformat lines that begin with java.lang.Exception.

trans-unit.source: Save Program.cs, and then build the project.
trans-unit.target: Save Program.cs, and then build the project.

trans-unit.source: Pig streaming expects the application to be local on the cluster file system.
trans-unit.target: Pig streaming expects the application to be local on the cluster file system.

trans-unit.source: Enable Remote Desktop for the HDInsight cluster, and then connect to it by following the instructions at <linkText>Connect to HDInsight clusters using RDP</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Enable Remote Desktop for the HDInsight cluster, and then connect to it by following the instructions at <linkText>Connect to HDInsight clusters using RDP</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Once connected, copy PigUDF.exe from the bin/debug directory for the PigUDF project on your local machine, and paste it to the %PIG_HOME% directory on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Once connected, copy PigUDF.exe from the bin/debug directory for the PigUDF project on your local machine, and paste it to the %PIG_HOME% directory on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: From the Remote Desktop session, start the Hadoop command line by using the Hadoop Command Line icon on the desktop.
trans-unit.target: From the Remote Desktop session, start the Hadoop command line by using the Hadoop Command Line icon on the desktop.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to start the Pig command line:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to start the Pig command line:

trans-unit.source: You will be presented with a grunt> prompt.
trans-unit.target: You will be presented with a grunt> prompt.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following to run a simple Pig job by using the .NET Framework application:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following to run a simple Pig job by using the .NET Framework application:

trans-unit.source: The DEFINE statement creates an alias of streamer for the pigudf.exe applications, and SHIP distributes it across the nodes in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: The DEFINE statement creates an alias of streamer for the pigudf.exe applications, and SHIP distributes it across the nodes in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Later, streamer is used with the STREAM operator to process the single lines contained in LOG and return the data as a series of columns.
trans-unit.target: Later, streamer is used with the STREAM operator to process the single lines contained in LOG and return the data as a series of columns.

trans-unit.source: The application name that is used for streaming must be surrounded by the \` (backtick) character when aliased, and ' (single quote) when used with SHIP.
trans-unit.target: The application name that is used for streaming must be surrounded by the \` (backtick) character when aliased, and ' (single quote) when used with SHIP.

trans-unit.source: After entering the last line, the job should start.
trans-unit.target: After entering the last line, the job should start.

trans-unit.source: Eventually it will return output similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: Eventually it will return output similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: In this document, you have learned how to use a .NET Framework application from Hive and Pig on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: In this document, you have learned how to use a .NET Framework application from Hive and Pig on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: If you would like to learn how to use Python with Hive and Pig, see <linkText>Use Python with Hive and Pig in HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you would like to learn how to use Python with Hive and Pig, see <linkText>Use Python with Hive and Pig in HDInsight</linkText><title></title>.
